title: Reflective Case Study for Designing Asynchronous Video Tutorials

context.prior_knowledge: Basic Digital Literacy and No Experience in Educational Content Creation
context.additional_context: A course for in-service elementary school teachers aimed at acquiring asynchronous video production skills and enhancing reflective design capabilities

learning_goals: Learners can identify three or more anticipated/unanticipated obstacles that may occur during the production of asynchronous video tutorials.
Learners can design and apply effective communication strategies with stakeholders to reduce design failures by 50% or more.
Learners can derive future improvement directions through reflective reflection on completed video tutorials, following a three-stage process.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
